Tucson wanted to be able to give all his comrades a victory that was long s=
ince well deserved.  But he could see that it would be difficult to achieve=
, but was still determined to carry out his promise.  He keeps an attentive=
 ear out on the situation, while trying to get a silent com over to Windlor=
d, Rat Trap, Kup, Straight Shot, and the others.  He starts by contacting K=
up and his team.

" Tucson to Kup, over.  The enemy seems to be gaining gro=
und but it could be some time before they reach us.  That could give you an=
d your team time to mobilize and divise a strategy that best fits your need=
s.  I'm fully confident in your abilities to assemble a plan, and any imput=
 you can give us is valuable.  But be careful, they could sneak up on us at=
 any time."

Night Shift now helps Talon, by sticking close to her, as he t=
oo fires rounds but keeps a shield over Talon and himself.

" I got your ba=
ck Talon, ain't gonna let no preds or cons take any pop shots at any of us!=
"

Tucson now contacts Rat Trap and Windlord.

" Tucson to Rat Trap and Win=
dlord, over.  What's your position?"

Rat Trap responds.

"Umm, we didn't e=
xactly get inta the fortress Wheels... We're tryn' but the only hole we cou=
ld find was a crevace in the wall."

Tucson responds.

" As long as you're =
both safe, that's all that counts."

Rat Trap sighs.

"Ain't good enough Wh=
eels, I want this ta work, not fail.  The only way ta get in is ta blast th=
is wall, but that'll start a riot for sure, and we don't wanna do that."

T=
ucson thinks for a moment.

"Hmmm...  You're right about the shots, we woul=
dn't want to do that...  But a chemical agent, similar to acid, may be able=
 to burn a way into that wall, without making any noise or disruptive movem=
ent.."

Rat Trap raises an optic.

"Ohhh yeahhhh, an acidic compound... Lik=
e the stuff in batteries..  Lemme see what I got under my fur, I know I kep=
t some goodies under here...."

He digs into his fur, and grins.

"Bingo.. =
 I found this while scrounging one day...  An old battery cell I picked up =
somewhere..  All we gotta do is open this up, get to the acidic chamber, an=
d see if that eats through the wall.  Windlord, got anything sharp ta cut i=
nta this?"

Back at the ark, Quickstride is taken aback by what is happenin=
g to him.

"What the?  Rodimus, is it me or did everything just go dark?  I=
 don't like this...  Watch your back sir, This isn't good, whatever it is."=


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
=
>
> The firepower reaching into the air is quite heavy! The skies are
> fai=
rly lit with smoke, fire and bright lights as the Maximals and
> Autobots a=
ttempt to defend themselves and their position. EMP rounds,
> while missing=
 their intended targets still disrupt the sweeps
> targeting locks for a mo=
ment a send their radar systems into temporary
> shut down. This allows Tal=
on's weapons fire to find a home, brining
> down yet another sweep, leaving=
 two of them in the air overhead.
> 
> Meanwhile Tuscon is able to get an a=
ssessment of the situation as
> there are currently no combatants on the gr=
ound. The sweeps are down
> to two now, well under half the number they sta=
rted out with. However
> he can see in the distance there are more sweeps r=
ising from an open
> door at the tower, and there are others as well. He st=
ill can get a
> bead on the sweeps, but the others rising up he had met bef=
ore =96 the
> soldiers Cyclonus had brought the tower when Tuscon was tryin=
g to
> fight his way out. However as the tower is still many kilometers awa=
y
> it will take a little bit of time for them to reach his position.
>

> 
> Meanwhile at the tower itself Rat Trap and Windlord are unable to fin=
d
> a true 'hole' in the tower itself. There does not appear to be any
> op=
en vents or handy cracks that lead thier way in. All the vents are
> curren=
tly closed, firmly and securely, and they would need to be,
> after all thi=
s is a tower designed to descend into liquid rock.
> However they are able =
to find a spot where the walls on the upper
> tower jut out slightly, a sma=
ll crevass. However it is very small, and
> it in no way leads into the tow=
er itself, but it is merely a small
> cubby hole type structure.
> 
> The o=
nly way discernable into the tower itself, short of blowing a
> hole in the=
 wall, and judgingh by the material of the wall this would
> take a lot of =
firepower, the only way in is the large door that the
> soldiers had just l=
eft from - the door that is even now continuing to
> close.
>

> At t=
he Ark there is no answer to Quickstride's challenge. The air that
> had ri=
ppled before stopped, or atleast it was no longer visible to
> him.
> 
> "W=
hat do you see?" Rodimus' voice comes over the speaker. "My sensors
> aren'=
t picking up anyth . . ." Rodimus' voice goes silent as the world
> around =
Quickstride goes completely dark. He cannot see anything, not
> even his ha=
nd in front of his face, nor can he hear anything, not even
> the sound of =
his own voice. It is like his audio and visual sensors
> have gone offline.=
